title: RIP Satoru Iwata
body: RIP Satoru Iwata. I never could play as many Nintendo games as I wanted too, but what I did will always be a fond memory.

replies.body:
Satoru always focused on making great games, I grew up with a nintendo (and fought with siblings over who's turn it was to play)
Satoru was all about the games, they said he didnt want to just jump on every little bandwagon that came across. 
I am Hopefull they find someone likeminded as him to run the company in his place
I worry that now that he is gone, his replacement will shift the company focus -away- from making great games, and more focus on just making the shareholders obscenely, disgustingly rich. 

Satoru Iwata chose Games/Story over profit
I worry his replacement will choose Profit over Games/story. 

May he rest in peace untill he is ready to come back in another life. And if he does return, may he retain that desire to make great games with him upon beginning his next life.

omg... He helped make the first games I ever played... games that helped me get through my school years and even kept me from making some huge mistakes in my life. rest in peace Mr. Iwata. You will be missed.

All he wanted was for us to understand.

In all sincerity though, he was one of my heroes. I know I may not climb to his summit and uphold a legacy such as he, but I still strive to be as great and selfless as he was.

He made amazing contributions to this world, and I loved him dearly. We Nintendo and Non-Nintendo fans alike rued the day that this would come, yet...Here it stands before us.

May you continue making great games and striving for peoples happiness in the stars, Mr. Satoru Iwata.

I will always be a fan of your work.

a form of Bile duct cancer

I wonder, did he play League at all? I wonder what his opinion of Riot was if he did play. In any case, RIP Mr. Iwata. Nintendo has always done right by me and the games I played growing up are unforgettable. What I find really upsetting about all this is he died with fans telling him his E3 panel failed and they even started a petition to shut down production of a game he was working on.
RIP and thanks for all of the fond memories you helped give me!
R.I.P

As he moves on I hope the games he developed are still loved, just as he should be loved even though he is no longer with us. Nothing can express that sadness in me that has come with the passing of the producer of my childhood.
Rest in peace buddy
Shit this is a joke?! Omg... i love nintendo, it guided me through my childhood and now to hear this...holy..

He was a visionary. Regardless of whether I agree with his approach lately, I can't deny his vision.

Rest in peace.
